elementText.text:
Payment of the pending compensation of dowry: On the first day of Dûzu (IV) B2 and his brothers will pay to fA (their stepmother) 3 minas of silver. This is instead of the dowry (nudunnû) which her husband B1, father of the brothers, promised to give her in addition to (elat) the slave woman fC who is also part of the dowry. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina mahar) the judges (dayyānu) Bēl-iddin, Nargiya and Munahhiš-Marduk each of whom also put a sealing (kunukku) on the tablet. Except for the scribe no other witnesses are mentioned.
 
fA = fBu’ītu/Šamaš-mukīn-apli; B1 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = fNanāya-bēlu-uṣrī; Scribe = Līšir//Išparu

elementText.text:
Transfer of dowry: B promised to give to (his son-in-law) A1 a dowry (nudunnû) along with his daughter fC, consisting of 5 minas of silver, the (slaves) fD1 and fD2 and household goods (udê bīti). In the present document the groom and the bride are paid (eṭēru Stat.) the said goods. In addition (elat) to these goods, they (already) received the jewelry (šukuttu) worth 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver that fA2, mother of A1, put on fC as a marriage gift (biblu). 2(+) witnesses and the scribe (name lost).
 
A1= Mušēzib-Marduk/Ṣillāya//Sūhāya; fA2 = fBurāšu; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = fIna-Esagil-râmat/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; fD1 = fNanāya-lummir; fD2 = fNanāya-kēširat

elementText.text:
Promised transfer of a dowry: Along with his daughter fC, B1 voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) promises to give as a dowry (nudunnû) 3 minas of silver, 20 reeds (980 square cubits = 245 m2) of land in Sippar adjoining the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the gods and the king and the house of D, 0;2 square kor (5,400 m2) of land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) located between the Nāru-ša-šalla Canal and the Tīl-Gubbi Hill, a slave (amīlūtu) and household goods (udê bīti) to A. B1 will give the dowry to (his son-in-law) A on the day he marries. 6 witnesses (including Iqīša/Dayyān-Marduk//Ṣāhit-ginê, father of A, and Taqiš-Gula/Bēl-ahhe-iddina//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ašābi) fB2, mother of fC and wife of B1.

A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Šamaš-mukīn-apli/Mušēzib-Bēl//Balīhu; fB2 = fZazītu, mother of fC and wife of B1; fC = fBu’ītu/Šamaš-mukīn-apli//Balīhu; D = Rēmut-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ//Isinnāya; Scribe = Mušēzib-Marduk/Šulāya//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Oath concerning the payment of silver: B swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that until (adi) the 1st of Abu (V) he will finish (šalāmu D-stem) the legal case (amātu) concerning the 7 kor (1,260 l) of barley of the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2, father of A1, established at his expense of and that his words (amātu) will certainly be truthful (kēnu). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušēbši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Na’id-[DN]/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšišu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1 owes A 1/3 mina of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. B1 will pay it on the 15th of Tašrīt (VII). The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). The 1st, 2nd, 11th and 12th day of each month of the prebend of the butcher’s prebend (isiq ṭābihūti) in Ebabbar, temple of Šamaš of Sippar, is placed as a pledge. This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 4 1/3 minas of silver, without interest (qaqqadu), of A due from B2, father of B1, for which the gatekeeper’s prebend (isiq atûti) of the main gate (abullu) and 0;0.3 kor (18 l) of bread before Šarrat-Sippar have been placed as a pledge. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nergal-ahhē-iddin/Marduk-bēl-napšāti//Šangû-Šamaš; B1 = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Bēl-ittannu/Nabû-zēru-līšir/Ša-ṭābtīšu

elementText.text:
Receipt of rent: A receives from B 1 mina and 18 shekels of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. It is the payment for the rent (idū) of the house and for the šugarrû (= date palm product) that was still needed to be paid for the period from Arahsamna (VIII) of Darius 25th year until the end of Ṭebēt (X) of the present year, i.e. for the past 3 years and 3 months. After A will have brought the document (šaṭāru) in Šabāṭ (XI) of the present year, B will entrust (paqādu) to A the bīt kuruppi-warehouse. After the said period, B has to pay 2 shekels of white silver per month to A. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Bēl-zēri/Bunene-ibni; Scribe = Marduk-ēreš/Nabû-mukīn-apli

elementText.text:
Loan of dates and silver: B owes A 83 kor (14,940 l) of dates and 2 minas of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The house of B at the quay of Sippar (Kār-Sippar), bordering the houses of C1 and fC2, is placed as a pledge from Tašrīt (VII) of the present year onwards to secure 1 mina of the indebted silver. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of white silver per mina (20% p.a.). B will pay the debts in Arahsamna (VIII) on the quay of Sippar in the house of A. 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumu-ukīn/Bunene-ibni; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C1 = Iddināya/Kī-Sîn; fC2 = fAsītu-tabni; Scribe = Ina-ṣilli-Bēl/Niqūdu

The house of the debtor, adjoining the […] street (sūqu) and the houses of C1 and C2, is placed as a pledge. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). elementText.text:
Oath concerning the redemption of debts: B swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that before the 1st of Kislīm (IX) of Darius 6th year he will bring along (abāku) the flock (ṣēnu) and draw up the accounts (nikkassu epēšu) with A1 about the offspring (tamlittu), the shorn wool (gizzatu) and the donkeys on the basis of the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2. B will satisfy A1 (harrānu ana šēpē ša A1 šakānu). 5 witnesses (including Nergal-šumu-iddin, brother of A2 and uncle of A1) and the scribe. This is in addition to (elat) the summons (šaṭāru ša adannāti).
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš

elementText.text:
Fragmentary lease contract concerning plough oxen: A rents out for cultivation (ana errēšūti nadānu) 4 plough oxen (alpu ša epinni) to B1 and B2. They guarantee for taking care (suddudu) and the guard (maṣṣartu) of the oxen. In case they do not work (epēšu) the land, they shall pay the same rate as their neighbours. For the period of 5 months the lessor will give 0;0.1.3 kor (9 l) of barley as a monthly ration (kurummatu) to the lessee B1. 2 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Lâbâši/Bēl-ahhē-erība; B2 = Gimillu/Ipria//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-šumu-līšir//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili

elementText.text:
Joint lease of animals: A jointly rents out (ana zitti nadānu) to B his 2 white female donkeys, 2 male yearling donkey foals (mūru) and 1 two-year-old female donkey-foal for 1 1/3 minas of silver which he will obtain in full (šalāmu) from the offspring (tamlittu) of the animals. They will equally (ahāta) share the profit (utru). Of the fertile ewes from among 100 female small livestock – 60 fertile (ālittu) ewes, 30 female lambs (parratu) and 10 fertile she-goats – B will give the male and female lambs (parru u parratu) during 2 years. Per 100 ewes he shall give 2 talents and 10 minas of wool, including (adi) the shorn wool (gizzatu) of the female lambs. The present contract is apart from (elat) the 3-year-old donkey of A. B guarantees (pūtu našû) for taking care (suddudu) and the guard (maṣṣartu) of the donkeys. Per goat he shall give 5/6 mina of hair (šārtu). 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; Scribe = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu/Bēl-kāṣir//Sîn-dā’in

elementText.text:
Duplicate of a slave sale for the redemption of debts: C has voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) sold his two slaves (amīlūtu), the bakers (nuhatimmu) D1 and D2, to fB, his wife, for 2 minas of silver. C guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu) – the two bakers are neither of the status of royal servants (arad šarrūti) nor of the status free persons (mār banûti) nor “new break (hēpu)” in text. Out of the sum of 2 minas of silver, 56 shekels are used to pay A. 2 witnesses and the scribe. The text is linked to the loan document BM74962.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Iqīša; fB = fNin-[…]/Lâbâši//[…]; C = Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Isinnāya; D1 = Ina-ṣilli-Bīt-Akītu; D2 = Ar-[…]; Scribe = Iddin-Marduk/Bēl-zēri//Sîn-tabni

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 6 kor (1,080 l) of barley and 6 kor (1,080 l) of dates. He will pay the barley in Ayyār (II) and the dates in Tašrīt (VII). The dates are those which the creditor registered (uzuzzu) in the treasury (namkūru) of Šamaš on behalf of (ana muhhi) the debtor. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nidintu/Sūqāya//Ile’i-Marduk; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk

elementText.text:
Fragmentary oath: [B] swears to A by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will bring him 1 ½ minas of silver and hand them over (našû-nadānu) on the 24th of Simān (III). If he fails to do so, the garment mender (mukabbû) C, slave (qallu) of [B], will become property of A. Remainder, including witness list and date formula lost.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; [B] = name lost; C = Nabû-ina-Esagil-lummir

elementText.text:
Oath concerning the stay in Sippar: B swears (tamû) to A by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that are no longer any debt notes (u’iltu rašûtu) due from him. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Šumu-ukīn/Bunene-ibni; Scribe = Balāṭu/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 20 minas of white cut silver (kaspu ṣepû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). The debtor’s field is placed as a pledge until (adi) A has obtained in full (šalāmu) the credited sum of silver which he took up as guarantor (pūtu našû) for B on account of (ina qātē) D. The said field is located in Du(r)bissu and borders (the properties of) the judge (dayyānu) C1, C2 and C3 and the banks (kišādu) of the Euphrates as well as the Du(r)bissu Canal. 6 witnesses and the scribe. Seal impression (kunukku) of B.
 
A = Ṭābia/Nabû-šumu-iškun; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C1 = Uštānu, dayyānu (judge); C2 = Kalbi-Bābu; C3 = Lullā/Zabdia; D = Šulum-Bābili; Scribe = Bēl-nādin-apli//Eṭēru

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: The scribes (ṭupšarru) of Ebabbar B1 and B2 owe A 55 kor (9,900 l) of dates. They will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) in Darius 20th year. With the equivalent of the dates in silver the two debtors paid for the sheep and oxen that are needed for the regular offerings (ginê) of Šamaš of the months Dûzu (IV), Abu (V) and Ulūl (VI). This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) of 25 kor (4,500 l) of dates in the name (ana šumi) of C and the 6 kor of dates, remainder (rēhu) of the previous promissory notes due from (ina muhhi) the scribes B1 and D. The two debtors will bring the dates from the treasury (namkūru) of Šamaš and hand them over (našû-nadānu) to the creditor. 9 witnesses and the scribe. Seal impression (kunukku) of B2.
 
A = Šamaš-uballiṭ/[…]; B1 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-līšir//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili, ṭupšar Ebabbar (scribe of Ebabbar); B2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, ṭupšar Ebabbar (scribe of Ebabbar); C = Šamaš-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun; D = Habaṣīru, ṭupšarru (scribe); Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš

elementText.text:
Receipt of barley and wheat: A receives from C1 and C2, servants of B, 50 kor of barley and 2 kor of wheat. This is a partly repayment according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of A concerning 600 kor of dates and 400 kor of barley due from (ina muhhi) B which is guaranteed (pūtu našû) by C1. This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 100 kor of dates, but includes the 17 kor of barley from D. 9 witnesses (including Bēl-uballiṭ/Šamaš-iddin//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy (šaṭāru).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Erība-Marduk/Nidinti-Marduk; C1 = Šamšāya, slave of B; C2 = Nannia, slave of B; D = Šagê; Scribe = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Erība-Marduk//Rē’i-sisê

elementText.text:
Decision about repayment: B will bring along (abāku) and pay (eṭēru) A1 the entire flock (ṣēnu) on the 1st of Kislīm (IX) of Darius 6th year according to (akî) the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2. Instead of the ewes (ṣēnu ālittu), which are part of the offspring (tamlittu) of the flock, fC, slave woman (qallatu) of B with a wrist (rittu) branded (šaṭāru) with B’s name, belongs to (pāni dagālu) A1. 5 witnesses (including Nergal-šumu-iddin, brother of A2 and uncle of A1) and the scribe.

A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; fC = fNanāya-ana-bītīšu; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš

elementText.text:
Oath concerning the holding of a lawsuit: B1 swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will bring along (abāku) his father B2 to Sippar on the 22nd of Addar (XII). There he shall litigate (dabābu) with A1 about (ana muhhi) the flock (ṣēnu) of A2, A1’s father, which is at the disposal of B2. In case B2 does not litigate with A1, he will pay according to the verdict the judges (dayyānu) give (dânu). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Nabû-bullissu/Sîn-ahu-iddin; B2 = Sîn-ahu-iddin, father of B1; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Nergal-ēṭir//Ša-nāšišu

elementText.text:
Decision about the clearance of future claims: B2 shall clear (murruqu) from claims and give the thigh (pēmu) (of mutton) from offerings before the divine chariot (narkabtu) of Šamaš to A who bought it for 2 minas of white silver (kaspu peṣû) from B1, brother of B2. If B2 fails to do so, he has to pay the 2 minas of silver to A. Half a month (šapattu) of the butcher’s prebend (ṭābihūtu) in Ebabbar, Šamaš Temple in Sippar, and B2’s house at the Gate of Bunene (bāb Bunene) are placed as a pledge. 3(+) witnesses and the scribe (name lost). The text is linked to BM79783.
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Nūrea//Isinnāya; B2 = Šamaš-uballiṭ/Nūrea//Isinnāya

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina of cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear an interest of one shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Nidintu/Līšir//Išparu

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B owes A 50 kor (900 l) of barley. The debtor will pay the barley in Simān (III). C, priest (šangû) of Sippar, guarantees (pūtu našû) and swears (tamû) by Bēl and the king for the punctual (adannu ul-te-ti-qu = the deadline shall not expire) payment (eṭēru). 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Aqabu/Basia; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Guzānu, šangû (priest) of Sippar; Scribe = B

elementText.text:
Loan of a garment: B owes A one uzāru-garment of good quality (babbanû). He will give it on the 1st of Addar (XII). If he does not give, the debtor will pay 10 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginne). 3 witneses and the scribe.
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B = Šamaš-iddin/Šamaš-rē’išunu; Scribe = Lâbâši/Nabû-nāṣir//Nannûtu

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1, B2 and B3 owe A 380 kor (68,400 l) of dates. They have sworn (tamû) to the creditor by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that they will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu, in the enclosure (haṣāru), in one delivery (ina muhhi išten ritti). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru). The dates are meant for the white silver (kaspu peṣû) for the “fitting-out” (pasa’du) given to C by the rab banê. 13 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Arad-Bunene/Na’id-Marduk//Ile’i-Marduk; B2 = Ardia/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk; B3 = Iddin-Bēl/Šamaš-uballiṭ//Ile’i-Marduk; C = Balāṭu; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk

elementText.text:
Receipt of dowry: A receives from (his father-in-law) B [x] minas of silver, the remainder of 3 minas of silver which form part of the dowry (nudunnû) of his wife fC. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; fC = fNadāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk

Heavily broken loan document: B owes A1 and A2 [x] commodity. Details not preserved. 3(+) witnesses and the scribe.

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 40 shekels of stamped silver (kaspu ša ginni). He will pay in Šabāṭ (XI). The promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 28 ½ shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) and 17 shekels of stamped silver of A due from (ina muhhi) B is paid off (eṭēru Stat.). 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Nidinti-Bēl/Bēl-rēmanni; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhiṭ-ginê

elementText.text:
Clearance of future claims: C, the original owner of the right to a thigh (pēmu) of mutton from offerings before the divine chariot (narkabtu) of Šamaš of Sippar, will clear (murruqu) the thigh from any claims and give it to its present owner A, his grandnephew. A received it from B, who previously bought (ana kaspi mahāru) the right from C. 4 witnesses (including Tabnēa/Mušēzib-Marduk//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili) and the scribe. The text is linked to BM64210.

A = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B = Nabû-uṣuršu/Nūrea/Isinnāya; C = Iddin-Nabû/Marduk-nāṣir//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Ubalissu-Gula/Ahhē-iddin-Marduk//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
